protocol_name: Protein secretion efficiency of construct in Chlamydomonas reinhardtii with fluorescent protein
protocol_name_html: Protein secretion efficiency of construct in Chlamydomonas reinhardtii with fluorescent protein
description: This protocol describe how to asess secretion efficiency of diferrent constructs in Chalmydomonas reinhardtii, using a fluorescent protein. Colonies are picked from transformation plate and inoculated on TAP media for growth. A high number of colonies is picked to avoid bias on colonie picking.
before_start:
• Separate 96 well plates
  • Prepare sufficient media 
  • Separate gas exchangable seal
manuscript_citation: Molino JVD, Carvalho JCMd, Mayfield SP, Comparison of secretory signal peptides for heterologous protein expression in microalgae: Expanding the secretion portfolio for . PLoS ONE 13(2). doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0192433
guidelines: Cell cultures in 96 well plates should ideally be cultivated at high orbital shaking (>800RPM) to avoid suboptimal growth.

components.data:
1. Pippete 500 µL of TAP media to each well of a 96 deep-well plate 
  2. Pick single colonies with autoclavated pippete tips or teeth cleaning twigs. Add to the wells
  3. Cover plate with a gas exchangeable seal (Breathe-Easy®, Sigma-Aldrich®)
  4. Place plates on a rotary shaker (150 RPM) under constant illumination (50 µmol photons/m2s ), at 25 ºC for 7 days
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Pippete 500 µL of TAP media to each well of a 96 deep-well plate 
  2. Pick single colonies with autoclavated pippete tips or teeth cleaning twigs. Add to the wells
  3. Cover plate with a gas exchangeable seal (Breathe-Easy®, Sigma-Aldrich®)
  4. Place plates on a rotary shaker (150 RPM) under constant illumination (50 µmol photons/m2s ), at 25 ºC for 7 days

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Protein secretion efficiency of construct in Chlamydomonas reinhardtii with fluorescent protein
source_data.protocol_name: Protein secretion efficiency of construct in Chlamydomonas reinhardtii with fluorescent protein
source_data.protocol_name_html: Protein secretion efficiency of construct in Chlamydomonas reinhardtii with fluorescent protein
source_data.annotation: Low orbital shaker speed are sufficient for cell growth. Nevertheless, microtiter plate shakers can be used and enhance cell growth.
source_data.thread_text: Low orbital shaker speed are sufficient for cell growth. Nevertheless, microtiter plate shakers can be used and enhance cell growth.
source_data.body: Low orbital shaker speed are sufficient for cell growth. Nevertheless, microtiter plate shakers can be used and enhance cell growth.

components.data:
1. Remove seal and transfer 100 µL of culture to fluorescence reading in a clear bottom 96-well plate (Corning Costar, Tewksbury, MA, USA).
  2. Centrifuge the 96 deep-well plate at 3000xg for 10 min
  3. Transfer 100 uL of supernatant to fluorescence reading in a clear bottom 96-well plate (Corning Costar, Tewksbury, MA, USA).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Remove seal and transfer 100 µL of culture to fluorescence reading in a clear bottom 96-well plate (Corning Costar, Tewksbury, MA, USA).
  2. Centrifuge the 96 deep-well plate at 3000xg for 10 min
  3. Transfer 100 uL of supernatant to fluorescence reading in a clear bottom 96-well plate (Corning Costar, Tewksbury, MA, USA).

components.data:
1. Read fluorescence in the bottom of the plates at fluorescent protein specific wavelenghts in a plate reader

  2. Ex: mCherry fluorescent protein

    • Excitation: 575/9 nm
    • Emission: 608/20 nm
    • Gain: 200
  3. Read fluorescence in the bottom of the plates at chlorophyll specific wavelenghts in a plate reader

  4. Ex: Chlorophyll

    • Excitation: 440/9 nm
    • Emission: 680/20 nm
    • Gain: 100

source_data.annotation:
*Compare results of the whole culture fluorescence and supernatant fluorescence to estimate secretion efficiency.

 

**Check chlorophyll fluorescence to surveil for contaminations or cell growth failure.

components.data: 1. Read cell density by absorbance at 750 nm
